instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2850 one fan spin, other pulses
threads.message: Have a 2010 2850, that one fan spins, and the other "twitches"/pulses. Presents with very small amount of corrosion at J9000 but nowhere else. Customer reports that when trying to play graphic heavy games, it tends to crash.  I suspect the capacitor for that issue, but cant be quite sure just yet.  Ideas?

threads.title: 2850 one fan spin, other pulses
threads.message: Standard C9650 and a bad fan or dust ball trapped in it.

threads.title: 2850 one fan spin, other pulses
threads.message:
No Title

I have changed out the cap, and I get scrambled screen. The CPU gets really hot too. No other corrosion/liquid damage other than the two pins of LCD connector. I touched those up too. Get scrambled screen. Ideas?

threads.title: 2850 one fan spin, other pulses
threads.message: That is either bad GPU/VRAM or board trace issue. I don't fix 2850 with these symptoms as they always seem to return and be miserable.
